clinical_study.brief_title: Postpartum Management of Hypertension in Pregnancy With Hydrochlorothiazide
clinical_study.official_title: Postpartum Management of Hypertension in Pregnancy With Hydrochlorothiazide: a Randomized Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Medical Branch, Galveston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Medical Branch, Galveston

brief_summary.textblock: Postpartum prophylactic HCTZ administration for prevention and relapse of preeclampsia or gestational hypertension.

detailed_description.textblock: To evaluate effectiveness of hydrochlorothiazide prophylaxis on prophylaxis, prevention and relapse of preeclampsia or gestational hypertension on readmission rates, need for additional antihypertensive therapy and number of triage visits.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: double-blind randomized placebo controlled clinical trial
study_design_info.masking_description: Randomization will be performed by a person not involved in the clinical trial using a computer random list of numbers generated using STATA (StataCorp 14.0, Dallas, TX). This list of random number assignments will be kept secure and sent directly to the investigational drug service (IDS), who will be responsible for the allocation and dispensing of the medications

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of readmission and/or triage visits

primary_outcome.description: Requiring additional antihypertensive agents in the postpartum period

secondary_outcome.description: Days that patient required to be in-house in the postpartum period

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Additional doses of anti-hypertensive therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Addition of total doses that patient received in the postpartum period
Hypertension definition in the postpartum period
o Any of the following: ICU admission, HELLP syndrome, eclampsia, stroke, renal failure, pulmonary edema, cardiomyopathy or maternal death
hospital stay, postpartum clinic or emergency room visit within 4-6 weeks of delivery, need for imaging or other invasive procedures.
Allergic reactions (anaphylaxis, angioedema, skin rashes including Stevens Johnson and Toxic Epidermal necrolysis)

arm_group.description: Hydrochlorothiazide 50 mg per os once daily as soon as the subjects can tolerate sips of water after delivery and for a total of fourteen days postpartum.
Placebo per os once daily as soon as the subjects can tolerate sips of water after delivery and for fourteen days postpartum

intervention.description: Hydrochlorothiazide 50 mg per os once daily as soon as the subjects can tolerate sips of water after delivery and for a total of fourteen days postpartum.
Placebo per os once daily as soon as the subjects can tolerate sips of water after delivery and for a total of fourteen days postpartum

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Maternal age â‰¥ 18 years and <50 years.
- Diagnosis of gestational hypertension* or preeclampsia^ at any time during pregnancy, labor or postpartum.
- defined as isolated systolic BP of 140 mm Hg or greater, a diastolic BP of 90 mm Hg or greater, or both) or ^ defines as new-onset hypertension plus new-onset proteinuria, or in the absence of proteinuria, preeclampsia is diagnosed as hypertension in association with thrombocytopenia (platelet count less than 100,000/microliter), impaired liver function (elevated blood levels of liver transaminases to twice the normal concentration), the new development of renal insufficiency (elevated serum creatinine greater than 1.1 mg/dL or a doubling of serum creatinine in the absence of other renal disease), pulmonary edema, or new-onset cerebral or visual disturbances.)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject requiring antihypertensive therapy at time of screening.
- Planned discharge with oral anti-hypertensive medication.
- Contraindication to hydrochlorothiazide (advanced renal failure or anuria, hypersensitivity to sulfonamides).
- Subject not able to follow up postpartum.
- Lactose intolerance.
- Pre-gestational diabetes.
